title: Shipping & Cargo to Home Country - New In Abu Dhabi

content.text: Shipping & Cargo to Home Country

Need to send packages, furniture, or personal items back home? This guide lists trusted cargo companies in Abu Dhabi offering affordable shipping to your home country. Discover reliable sea freight, air cargo, and door-to-door services with transparent pricing, good reviews, and convenient pickup options—perfect for expats sending balikbayan boxes, household goods, or gifts to family.
Quick Guide: Choosing Your Cargo Service
For Small Packages & Gifts (Under 30kg)
Air Cargo: 3-7 days delivery, AED 25-45/kg
Best for: Electronics, documents, medicines, urgent items
For Large Shipments & Furniture (30kg+)
Sea Cargo: 4-8 weeks delivery, AED 8-15/kg
Best for: Balikbayan boxes, household items, bulk shopping
For Time-Sensitive Items
Express Air: 1-3 days delivery, AED 50-80/kg
Best for: Emergency documents, perishables
Top-Rated Cargo Companies by Destination
Philippines – Balikbayan Box Specialists
LBC Express – Multiple Abu Dhabi Locations
Type: Sea (Balikbayan box) & Air Cargo Door-to-Door
Branches: Tourist Club Area, Electra Street, Khalidiya, Mussafah
Pricing: Sea cargo from AED 115/box, Air from AED 35/kg
Rating: 4.4★ (500+ reviews)
Delivery: 2-3 weeks sea, 5-7 days air to Manila
“Most reliable for balikbayan boxes. Free pickup service and real-time tracking.”
Pro Tip: Book online for 10% discount on first shipment
JRS Express – Hamdan Street
Type: Sea & Air Cargo, Pasalubong boxes
Speciality: Refrigerated items, fragile goods packaging
Pricing: Competitive rates for Visayas/Mindanao destinations
Rating: 4.2★ (200+ reviews)
“Great for sending food items and delicate packages to provinces.”
India &  Pakistan – Subcontinent Services
Al Madina Cargo – Electra Street
Type: Air, Sea & Land freight to India/Pakistan/Bangladesh
Speciality: Personal effects, excess baggage, household goods
Pricing: Sea AED 12-18/kg, Air AED 28-42/kg
Rating: 4.3★ (150+ reviews)
Coverage: Major cities plus small towns via local partners
“Family-run business with personal service. They know the customs process well.”
BSC Cargo Service – Mussafah
Type: Air & Sea Cargo Door-to-Door
Speciality: Heavy machinery, furniture, vehicle parts
Community: Heavily used by Pakistani/Indian expat groups
Rating: 4.1★ (Facebook groups testimonials)
“Reliable for large shipments. Good rates for sea cargo to Karachi and Mumbai.”
Middle East & North Africa
ARC Worldwide – Khalifa Port Area
Type: Sea (FCL/LCL) & Air freight, door-to-door service
Destinations: Sudan, Syria, Egypt, Jordan
Speciality: Port Sudan direct route, Red Sea shipping
Rating: 4.1★ (50+ reviews)
Pricing: Competitive sea freight rates from Khalifa Port
“Regular departures to Port Sudan. Good for large furniture shipments.”
ADSO Group – Industrial Area
Type: Land freight specialist (trucks & convoys)
Routes: Syria via Jordan, Egypt via Saudi border
Speciality: Heavy cargo, customs clearance, border handling
Rating: 4.2★ (30+ reviews)
“Best for oversize items that can’t go by air. Handles all border paperwork.”
Al Fares Cargo – Multiple Locations
Type: Multi-modal (Air/Sea/Land), refrigerated containers
Coverage: Egypt, Syria, Sudan, Jordan, Lebanon
Speciality: Food items, temperature-sensitive goods
Rating: 4.3★ (75+ reviews)
Services: Split shipping, consolidation, customs clearance
“Excellent for mixed shipments. Refrigerated option for food items.”
Global & Multi-Country Services
GAC Logistics – KIZAD
Type: Full logistics provider (Air/Sea/Land)
Locations: Khalifa Industrial Zone (KIZAD), Mina Zayed
Services: Warehousing, customs, household relocation, corporate shipping
Rating: 4.4★ (100+ reviews)
Coverage: Worldwide network, 50+ countries
“Professional service for business and personal cargo. End-to-end tracking.”
DSS Logistics – Dubai/Abu Dhabi
Type: Air, Sea & Land freight to MENA & South Asia
Network: 32+ countries, door-to-door service
Speciality: Express services, document courier
Rating: 4.2★ (45+ reviews)
“Fast processing and good customer service. Reliable for urgent shipments.”
Money-Saving Tips for New Shippers
Packaging Smart
Use cargo company’s boxes for better rates (especially balikbayan boxes)
Double-wrap electronics and fragile items
Avoid branded boxes that attract customs attention
Cost Optimization
Sea vs Air: Sea is 60-70% cheaper but takes 4-6 weeks longer
Consolidation: Combine with friends/neighbors for better per-kg rates
Seasonal Timing: Avoid peak seasons (Christmas, Eid) for better rates
Documentation
Keep detailed packing lists for customs clearance
Take photos of valuable items before packing
Get insurance for shipments over AED 2,000 value
Timing Considerations
Ramadan/Eid: Expect 1-2 week delays
Monsoon Season: Sea freight to Asia may face weather delays
Holiday Seasons: Book 2-3 weeks in advance for guaranteed space
What to Expect: First-Time Shipping Process
Step 1: Get Quotes (1 day)
Visit 2-3 companies for price comparison
Ask about pickup service, insurance, and tracking
Step 2: Prepare Shipment (2-3 days)
Sort and pack items according to company guidelines
Prepare required documents (Emirates ID, passport copy)
Step 3: Pickup/Drop-off (Same day)
Most companies offer free pickup for shipments over 50kg
Get receipt with tracking number and estimated delivery date
Step 4: Track & Receive (3-8 weeks)
Use company app or website for tracking updates
Coordinate with recipient for customs clearance if needed
Red Flags to Avoid
Skip These Companies If They:
Don’t provide proper receipts or tracking numbers
Ask for full payment before seeing your items
Can’t show you proper licensing/permits
Have no physical office address in Abu Dhabi
Refuse to provide insurance options for valuable items
Good Signs of Reliable Service:
Clear pricing breakdown with no hidden fees
Proper packaging materials and procedures
Regular schedule of departures to your destination
Responsive customer service in your language
Established presence in Abu Dhabi expat community
